author: gstein
msg: I introduced a bug in my mods to Edmund's patch. He found; here's the fix.

author: gstein
msg: Fixed gen_win.py such that it checks for the presence of the Serf library
(which it does prior to this patch) and also outputs the library version
(which is what this patch does). It also checks if the serf version >=
0.3.0.  If not, ra_serf is not built.
(_get_serf_version): New function to return the serf library version.
(_find_serf): Added a version check and if a valid version is found,
ra_serf is built; otherwise, it isn't.  If the version cannot be
determined, ra_serf will still be built. The user is the informed of

author: arfrever
msg: (SVN_NEON_CONFIG): Update regular expressions to match Neon 0.30.

author: gstein
msg: A couple random things: constify some conflict stuff, and export conflict
(setup_text_conflict_desc): constify the return and the left/right
version structures. remove the access baton and take an abspath
instead. also take the is_binary flag since the caller can no longer
set it (cuz of the const). in order to get around const issues with
the left/right assignment, actually create a CD2 instead, and then
convert it on exit. eventually, we'll just return a CD2.
(merge_binary_file): constify the left/right version params. update the
call to setup_text_conflict_desc(), and no longer worry about setting
(read_one_tree_conflict): update references to the maps. move the
conflict creation lower in the function, and read directly into our
